title: Smart Snacking: Ayurvedic Mixes That Satisfy
author: Harish
excerpt: Ayurvedic snacking is about balance—nourishing foods, gentle spices, and mindful portions.
content:
The Ayurvedic Philosophy of Snacking

Snacking is best done with awareness—foods should be light, energizing, and easy to digest. Heavy, cold, or oily snacks increase Kapha and slow digestion.

Why Nuts & Seeds Work

  • Almonds: Warm, grounding, and nourishing.
  • Pumpkin Seeds: Mineral-rich and energizing.
  • Sesame: Builds strength and supports Vata.

Mild Digestive Spices

Spices like cumin and black pepper help the body break down fats and absorb nutrients better. They also prevent post-snack heaviness.

Portion Control = Key

Kapha types should limit portions to a small handful. Pitta and Vata can enjoy moderately but should combine with warm drinks for better digestion.
